title: Miss Fortune E
body: Miss Fortunes E base damage is nerfed from 310 to 220 damage on the PBE, while the AP ratio is unchanged. Even is she rushes Liandries Torment now she can't clear the ranged minions with her E. Please increase the AP ratio. Don't destroy this champion.

replies.body: I'll follow up with the designer working on the MF changes and get back to you, see what his thoughts are on the current state of AP builds on her (not familiar enough with them myself). Can't make any promises, if AP MF's in a decent spot on live at present though might be appropriate to increase a ratio somewhere to avoid an unintentional nerf.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=862qjYPM,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-01-10T02:25:46.741+0000)
>
> I'll follow up with the designer working on the MF changes and get back to you, see what his thoughts are on the current state of AP builds on her (not familiar enough with them myself). Can't make any promises, if AP MF's in a decent spot on live at present though might be appropriate to increase a ratio somewhere to avoid an unintentional nerf.

Thanks for looking at it!

Since MFs ult AD ratio was buffed to 1200% and the change of her W/passive, I think AP MF is not really worth it compared to AD MF. It is just that Dorans Ring is still a good starting item for her, that some AP from Glyphs and Natural Talent are still beneficial for her and that Gunblade is the best lifesteal item for her imo. Because her E has a high base damage, this spell gives her save waveclear even without much AP. Because of that I can understand to nerf the base damage. But I would like to be able to get the save waveclear back, if I sacrifice some AD for it, and I think AD builds are the thing you really want to nerf.

Safe waveclear is the only thing AP MF has compared to AD MF. Without that AP MF would be nothing.
I don't quite think it's 1200% XD. But yeah, fair points you've got. I don't play AP MF like at all, unless I'm cheesing around on ARAM

> [{quoted}](name=LilliththeStorm,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=862qjYPM,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-01-10T03:27:54.993+0000)
>
> I don't quite think it's 1200% XD. But yeah, fair points you've got. I don't play AP MF like at all, unless I'm cheesing around on ARAM

It sounds funny but it is true. MFs ult has a 1200% AD ratio at Level 3. 75% AD ratio per wave, 16 waves. It has a 360% AP ratio too, but 1200% AD is better. 

And the scaling can be increased with critical strikes: If you have 100% crit and IE, it has actually an AD ratio of 1560% AD (and 468% AP)

Okay, didn't think of the multiple waves factor. So essentially she has the -potential- for that kind of thing. 
But in essence the ratio is still 75% just with MANY occasions of damage, each with crit potential. 
All this put together makes it seem as though the scaling is 1200%(+) (I don't put crit and AD in the same scaling here personally, they're separate, if very closely related stats). Each of these instances of damage are separately occurring though, so each one is individually affected by mitigation factors (armor, flat damage reduction, {{item:3143}} , armor pen, etc.) This makes it almost a necessity to hit most, if not all, of the waves to truly do massive damage (unless you get full build, then almost anything is boned XD).  If someone is smart they'll do whatever they can to avoid as many occasions of damage from the ult as possible. Admittedly this is made next to impossible by the team comp she is intended to be played in as-per rework direction/intention.

That's just my way of looking at it though. I can see and understand how and why you would see it the way you do, most certainly. And it is fairly obvious that AP MF is far weaker than AD just by numbers alone (Although {{item:3151}}, {{item:3285}}, and{{item:3116}} seem like they'd deal some pretty stupid DoT if used well, in addition to TLD), your initial pointwith this is still very, very much valid. If that seemed really confusing and disjointed, sorry. I have less than 2 hours of sleep in the past 48 hours.

> That's just my way of looking at it though. I can see and understand how and why you would see it the way you do, most certainly. And it is fairly obvious that AP MF is far weaker than AD just by numbers alone 

AP has one advantage especially in mid lane or in modes like ARAM. It is difficult for Adcs to farm against Mages. If they walk in AA range of a minion, the Mage can hit them easily with long range abilitys. But AP MF has one of the best ranged waveclear abilitys in the game. She can just kill the minions faster than the opponent, so the opponent has to concentrate on farm, while MF can poke him. AP MF is a really strong lane bully.

What did change in the preseason?

In Season 5 MFs Ult had only an AP scaling of 180% and a low AD scaling, that did magic damage. But the physical base damage was higher. If you wanted a strong ult, AP and Armor penetration were the best stats. AP was ofc the best stat for her E. Her Q was perfect for Sheen, because of the 1.7 s CD with 40% CDR.

My favorite build was:
- Dorans Ring
- Nashors Tooth/Morellonomicon
- CDR-boots
- Liandries Torment
- Trinity Force
- Last Whisper
- Gunblade/Botrk/Bloodthirster

In the preseason some things changed:

Her E range was increased by 200 and Her ult AP ratio was doubled to 360%. On the other hand her ult base damage was lowered and her base AD was gutted. Therefore she got her love tap passive, which scales really well with AD. And her ult was given a crazy 1200% AD ratio.

It was not a big change for AP MF, but AD MF was just buffed into the sky. At the same time AD itemization for CDR was buffed too. The only nerf was the base AD nerf, which gutted her synergy with Triforce too.

Now my favourite build was:
- Dorans Ring
- Essence Reaver
- Swiftness boots
- Infinity Edge
- Triforce/Lich bane
- Gunblade
- Defensive Item

Some early AP from runes, masteries and Dorans is still the best for dominating the mid lane, but AD is just more worth afterwards.

If the E base damage is nerfed, but an AP ratio compensation is given, there could even be a better reason again to buy some more AP.

But without a compensation I think AP MF is just getting pointless, what would be sad because she was great hybrid champion. Actually a champion where a hybrid build was better than pure AP and pure AD.

> (Although {{item:3151}}, {{item:3285}}, and{{item:3116}} seem like they'd deal some pretty stupid DoT if used well, in addition to TLD)

E slows anyway so Rylais is not really needed.

Yeah, all points make sense. My thing with the rylais is that her E is a (relatively) small area compared to her ult, applying the slow with ulti would make it more difficult for enemies to escape w/o burning flash, or some other dash ability, and allowing the bonus damage against movement impaired enemies on Liandrys to proc on anyone not within the e range. Plus, the sheer power of Rylais is insane, the health, AP, and slow you get from it is really strong for what is paid IMO.
This. The slow with her ult is really amazing the amount of times i've died or nearly died because of it is crazy.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=862qjYPM,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-01-10T02:25:46.741+0000)
>
> avoid an unintentional nerf.

You're nerfing the base damage on the spell, the nerf is already intentional.  Depending on any AP changes you make will either make her AP early game weaker or late game stronger.  There is no in-between.

Whelp, I've stopped playing MF altogether because of patch 5.22 and I'd only played her AP a few times before that anyways, so this doesn't concern me.  I just wanted to point out that one inconsistency in your words.

We're intentionally nerfing AD MF with nerfs to her passive and E. It's possible AP MF may be getting unintentionally nerfed at the same time, I'm unsure whether or not that build's been assessed internally relative to this change.

A base damage nerf and AP ratio buff would certainly change AP MF's power curve, keeping that build generally power neutral overall should be doable though if we conclude that's appropriate here.

Why are you even nerfing her E? The problem isn't her Make It Rain, it's the Thunderlords instantly procing off it. This wasn't a problem until Thunderlords randomly got a massive AD buff. I genuinely do not understand why ADs get to use most  Keystones, but AP champs only get to use Thunderlords (and some niche blackfire users who have all been nerfed because of it).

> [{quoted}](name=Buffy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=862qjYPM,comment-id=0002000300000003,timestamp=2016-01-10T13:26:12.113+0000)
>
> Why are you even nerfing her E? The problem isn't her Make It Rain, it's the Thunderlords instantly procing off it. This wasn't a problem until Thunderlords randomly got a massive AD buff.

Thunderloards was strong for Miss Fortunes E since the beginning. The AD ratio was buffed from 20% to 30%, but thunderloards is still very base damage heavy. If MF has 200 Bonus AD Thunderloards does now 230 instead of 210 damage at Level 18. Who cares? It was just underrated before Favor of Battle and Warloards were nerfed. The other keystones were nerfed and at the same time people found out how strong Thunderloards really is. And now 80% of the champions use it. But if everyone would have tried it in 5.22 it would have been much more popular back than too.

>The AD ratio was buffed from 20% to 30%

Due to a bug the original AD ratio was 10%. In one patch the AD ratio was tippled.

It's fairly significant when it's procing literally every single time it's up. That damage adds up, especially in lane when you're using it to harass. Thunderlords was never weak on MF, but buffing it certainly didn't help at all. Also, MF should easily be getting much more than 200 bonus AD by late game. 

I'm still in the camp that believes each ability should only be issuing one proc of it. Things like Nasus' spirit fire and MF's Make it Rain should not be auto procing for no effort. The abilities themselves aren't broken, and if MF needs nerfs, Make It Rain doesn't seem like the place to do it.

Edit: As someone else stated, the AD ratio was also originally only 10% due to a bug, but it got tripled to 30%. The AP ratio on it actually got nerfed due to the same bug.  There's also the matter that Thunderlords originally had an uptime of like 30 seconds, which got significantly chopped down.

> [{quoted}](name=Buffy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=862qjYPM,comment-id=000200030000000300000001,timestamp=2016-01-10T14:41:54.721+0000)
>
> It's fairly significant when it's procing literally every single time it's up. That damage adds up, especially in lane when you're using it to harass. Thunderlords was never weak on MF, but buffing it certainly didn't help at all. Also, MF should easily be getting much more than 200 bonus AD by late game. 

In lane for example at Level 5 Thunderloards does 50 base damage, and MF has about 30 Bonus AD at that point, so the ratio adds 9 damage. That is not much compared to 50 base damage.

In the late game 300 Bonus AD is typical for an AD caster build and 200 is typical for an Adc build. MF will be probably inbetween but closer to 200 most of the time.

> I'm still in the camp that believes each ability should only be issuing one proc of it. Things like Nasus' spirit fire and MF's Make it Rain should not be auto procing for no effort. The abilities themselves aren't broken, and if MF needs nerfs, Make It Rain doesn't seem like the place to do it.

Yes, I liked the synergy, but if it means that the abilitys get nerfed, it is indeed better to let them only count once towards the thunderloards proc. Balance-wise it is a little bit of an unfair advantage for champions with many damage procs.

It's 10 more damage every time it's up, which is pretty significant. This is in addition to the uptime going lower as well (original CD was 30 seconds) which is much more time to wait to proc it on original release. As someone else pointed out, the original AD ratio was actually 10% due to a bug, so it actually got tripled in one patch, in addition to getting a drastically shorter cooldown. 

Late, late game, she would likely have Berserks, IE, Bloodthirster, Essence Reaver, Statik (or Firecannon), and LW (or Mercurial). This should put her close to around 300 bonus AD with runes and masteries.

> [{quoted}](name=Buffy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=862qjYPM,comment-id=00020003000000030000000100000000,timestamp=2016-01-10T15:08:14.556+0000)
>
> It's 10 more damage every time it's up, which is pretty significant. This is in addition to the uptime going lower as well (original CD was 30 seconds) which is much more time to wait to proc it on original release. As someone else pointed out, the original AD ratio was actually 10% due to a bug, so it actually got tripled in one patch, in addition to getting a drastically shorter cooldown. 

Ok, the CD buff is actually very important.

> Late, late game, she would likely have Berserks, IE, Bloodthirster, Essence Reaver, Statik (or Firecannon), and LW (or Mercurial). This should put her close to around 300 bonus AD with runes and masteries.

I would buy an defensive item, because her damage is very high even without a glass canon build. And she has no escape.

That's her core build at high elo: http://champion.gg/champion/MissFortune/ADC

Averages a 53-56% win rate, so can't be too bad X: 

If you need a defensive item, it's probably better to just skip LW and grab a Mercurial.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=862qjYPM,comment-id=000200030000,timestamp=2016-01-10T11:17:59.502+0000)
>
> We're intentionally nerfing AD MF with nerfs to her passive and E. It's possible AP MF may be getting unintentionally nerfed at the same time, I'm unsure whether or not that build's been assessed internally relative to this change.
> 
> A base damage nerf and AP ratio buff would certainly change AP MF's power curve, keeping that build generally power neutral overall should be doable though if we conclude that's appropriate here.


To say that you're a visionary would be an understatement and a gross characterization not worthy of your sagely insight, Meddler. It was that pesky E all along, right? That's definitely going to put Miss Fortune back in check and ensure that her kit once again becomes healthy. 100% guaranteed. 

A typical day at the Riot office:

Scarizard: "So guys, it seems like Miss Fortune is a bit overwhelming at the moment. Any suggestions?"

Jagg: "She just doesn't do enough physical damage. Lets nerf her by buffing her AD ratios but make her suggested build really weird to fool players into building her improperly?"

Scarizard: "That's a good direction, but I'm looking for something more. Any other ideas?"

CertainlyT: "How about we rework her and make it so she can only auto once on every full moon, but only during Tuesdays and she has to bind her auto attacks to her ctrl+3 so she's also spamming laugh while reciting the Canadian anthem backwards while sitting in her bathroom playing League on her portable toaster?"

Scarizard: "Holy Jamaican pirate nipples Batman - I absolutely love it! Anything else?"

Meddler: "It's her E lmao. Let's just nerf that." *continues to speak in indiscernible English*

Scarizard: "Wow! That's obviously the best idea of the bunch. I think we're going to go with that folks."

Repertoir: "Ummm...but what about her ultimate that pretty much 1 shots squishies and relies heavily on RNG, making it unhealthy for the overall game. Plus, the unfair amount of attack speed her W gives her, which allows her to forgo a tradition attack speed item in favor of more damage and critical strike, thus making her damage output even more unpredictable and unhealthy?"

Scarizard: ".....shut up Repertoir."

Jagg: "Yeah, man. You think you're all clever with your logical yet completely UNINTERESTING ideas?"

CertainlyT: "Just go do something lame, like working yourself to death all day trying to actually improve the League of Legends experience in a meaningful way or communicating in a reasonable manner with those chumps on the Boards."

Meddler: "Pffff....Repertoir, what a loser. Nerrrrd."

Scarizard at the Riot offices later that day with KateyKhaos and others:

Scarizard: "And so then Meddler dropped a knowledge bomb on us all: nerf her E lmao!!"

*The group laughs in unison and walks away, knowing that they've done their best work to improve League of Legends once again*
wow, lmfao, good shit my boy!

Just fix Thunderlord's proccing off DoTs, DoTs have Deathfire Touch already.
However, AP MF bing stronger lategame wouldn't sure hurt anyone, kiting with her E gets so difficult towards the end.

I mean, you're seeking nerfs instead of looking for a way to fix or redo a failed redesign, but at least you seem dedicated to making certain an uncommon alternative playstyle remains relatively in-tact.  Good to know you have your priorities straight.

Well, almost 3 weeks have past, so have you at Riot made a decision about AP MF's fate? As someone who used to main this build until the patch 6.1 nerf if feels quite distressing not knowing whether or not you intend to buff her and I gradually lose hope with every new PBE update.

If AP MF's balance is an issue for you I'm always open to discussion on how to appropriately buff her.

Thank you for looking at Mage Fortune. It's definitely worth preserving this playstyle viable, which is actually quite unique and much different than regular MF. Increasing the AP ratio by 20-30% will make her break even at mid-late game. A positive side of such a buff will be that AP MF will have a better distinguished identity over AD MF.

Meddler, have you guys considered returning a windup time to Bullet Time? I love Miss Fortune, I really do, and I realize she's way too strong at the moment. But I feel like her ult is a gigantic catastrophe at the moment, which don't get me wrong, I ***LOVE*** that about her! I waited 5 years for a catastrophic Miss Fortune ult, but I feel like without the wind up time, teams don't have a whole lot of of time to react to it given Make It Rain's long**er** range now and instant, powerful slow.

That, or reducing Make It Rain's range back to 800, or maybe 900 from 1000. Maybe even both, if she's still too strong?

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=862qjYPM,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-01-10T02:25:46.741+0000)
>
> I'll follow up with the designer working on the MF changes and get back to you, see what his thoughts are on the current state of AP builds on her (not familiar enough with them myself). Can't make any promises, if AP MF's in a decent spot on live at present though might be appropriate to increase a ratio somewhere to avoid an unintentional nerf.

Sir, What do you think of the practice of buffing/nerfing semi-permeneant things based on transient changes (like masteries), and the practice of nerfing things which in and of themselves are not broken or overpowered and instead make something else more powerful?

Things like make it rain, morganas puddle, anivias R, and singed trail shouldnt proc thunderlords because it is, in theory, "one ability" isnt it?

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=862qjYPM,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-01-10T02:25:46.741+0000)

Can't make any promises, if AP MF's in a decent spot on live at present though might be appropriate to increase a ratio somewhere to avoid an unintentional nerf.

So did you come to the conclusion that AP Miss Fortune was too strong before the nerf? That would be sad, because I don't even consider to pick her anymore.

im going to start a petition to get you fired, first of all MF does not need nerfs, you are destroying MF with that nerf, i should just go back to vayne/lucian/trist because they are the kings of adc atm, but oh hey axe MF, gj imbeciless
imbeciles...... you have good points but you had me lost it when you said that,

BASED MEDDLER coming though as always

love ya man could you also have them take a look at AP tristana? the Change of her E from magic to physical damage was pretty huge. I was really excited to try her out when i read that Ult and W applied ult stacks but ingame it ended up being very mediocre.

please ask them if they coulda increase the AP ratio on the E

> [{quoted}](name=Nicole Watterson,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=862qjYPM,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2016-01-10T03:37:20.268+0000)

> 
> please ask them if they coulda increase the AP ratio on the E

There is always some jackamonkey trying to hijack a thread after a red post.
They keep killing all of our offbuilds or giving the main build unfair advantages in what is supposed to be the core of the offbuild....
meanwhile it procs thunderlords in 1 sec and that miss fortune is becoming the next {{champion:22}} support

Us few AP Miss Fortune players unite! 

Although... Liandry's are not actually good for clearing minions. If you want to clear better, get a Luden's.

The salty AP Miss Fortune players are coming out strong with the downvotes today boyz. Straight up, AP Miss Fortune players who are so set on being "different" and "unique" are literally the worst. Plus AP MF isn't even fun. They're worse than the people who play cheesy shit like AD Malzahar or Devourer Ekko (especially in ranked) and you can bet that they'll downvote this comment too because they can't stand to see an opinion that's in opposition to their own skewed perspectives. It's sad, really.
Say goodbye to AP mf. It's not ruining, it's fixing.
Nerf her to the ground
